p: According to research findings, increasing time and temperature will increase the solubility and extractability of compounds; however, plant phenolics may undergo enzymatic oxidation and reactions forming undesirable compounds under such conditions [ 76, 77]. Sample matrix and particle size also strongly influence phenolic extraction from plant materials [ 78]. Flavonoids are often extracted with methanol, ethanol, acetone, water, or mixtures of these solvents using heated reflux extraction methods [ 79â€“ 81]. Similarly, maximum extractability of flavonoids can be achieved using polar organic solvents alone or in combination [ 82, 83].
